page.title: 18Forestry
page.content: In our Domesday area there are a lot of plantations of trees.The spruce trees are close together and it is very dark in between the trees,so no wild life is under the trees but the trees grow quicker because the trees grow up to the light.Trees are felled by men for the cones which hold seeds.The cones are put into an oven to make them open up quickly.The trees are felled and taken away by a lorry to a sawmill .In our area we have a three sawmills. When the seeds have grown a man plants them. One man can plant 600 a day with an auger.The auger is a long pipe with a point on the end,the plant is put into the ground. A variety of trees grow in the area including Metasequoia and Copper beech, which were planted in the Melchet estate.Landford Lodge is today a nursery for deciduous trees.
